name: FGC Ferrocarrils de la Generalitat de Catalunya

reviews.text: We used the Metro in Barcelona a few times during our week-long stay there and found it quite efficient. It is quite cheap, the carriages are clean and the stations are also clean and easy to navigate.

Barcelona runs on the efficient metro system, many stations, well located, good pricing structure and operated by the city concil.

An alternative for certain destinations out of Placa Catalunya is  Ferrocarrils (ironrails) run by the Catalan Government. Superior carriages, quieter, faster and worth testing out as some of the routes to the north of the city are served by both systems.

We wanted to go to Montserrat Monastery,we walked to Catalona main station ,which is under ground,accessed by any steps on main island at station.
We walked following orange r5 signs,comeing to platforms,we bought tickets at kiosk,ask at any first.
There are numerous offers,train -plus cable car to monestary,NOTE you get off at first Montserrat stop,look for cable car on left,BUT if you buy train plus venicular,which is train up hill,it isCremallera,second stop,lots of people get off first stop by mistake and have to wait next train to go one more stop,an hour later.
If you do this get one way ticket up on cable car and return on venicular its so scenic,allow 30 minutes between conections.
Wear warm clothes as its cold up there.
The trains are punctual,clean with the route on front,inside seating is good,elevated .
there is a route map illuminated,showing each stop by name,it took about 1 hour to depart first train before asccending the mountain on cable car,pr 2nd stop,venicular train.
